s0121.literal: In the twenty-first year, Wang Ben attacked Jing.
s0121.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Wang Ben attacked Jing.

s0122.chinese: 乃益發卒詣王翦軍，遂破燕太子軍，取燕薊城，得太子丹之首。
s0122.literal: They further dispatched troops to Wang Jian's army, then defeated the Yan crown prince's army, took the Yan capital Ji, and obtained Crown Prince Dan's head.
s0122.idiomatic: They further dispatched troops to Wang Jian's army, then defeated the Yan crown prince's army, took the Yan capital Ji, and obtained Crown Prince Dan's head.

s0123.literal: The King of Yan went east to gather Liaodong and ruled it.
s0123.idiomatic: The King of Yan went east to gather Liaodong and ruled it.

s0124.literal: Wang Jian pleaded illness and old age and returned home.
s0124.idiomatic: Wang Jian pleaded illness and old age and returned home.

s0126.literal: Lord Changping was exiled to Ying.
s0126.idiomatic: Lord Changping was exiled to Ying.

s0127.literal: There was heavy snow, two and a half feet deep.
s0127.idiomatic: There was heavy snow, two and a half feet deep.

s0128.chinese: 二十二年，王賁攻魏，引河溝灌大梁，大梁城壞，其王請降，盡取其地。
s0128.literal: In the twenty-second year, Wang Ben attacked Wei, diverted river channels to flood Daliang; the city of Daliang collapsed, its king requested surrender, and all its territory was taken.
s0128.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Wang Ben attacked Wei, diverted river channels to flood Daliang; the city of Daliang collapsed, its king requested surrender, and all its territory was taken.

s0129.chinese: 二十三年，秦王復召王翦，彊起之，使將擊荊。
s0129.literal: In the twenty-third year, the King of Qin again summoned Wang Jian, forcibly roused him, and sent him to command the attack on Jing.
s0129.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, the King of Qin again summoned Wang Jian, forcibly roused him, and sent him to command the attack on Jing.

s0130.chinese: 取陳以南至平輿，虜荊王。
s0130.literal: He took territory from Chen south to Pingyu and captured the King of Jing.
s0130.idiomatic: He took territory from Chen south to Pingyu and captured the King of Jing.

s0131.literal: The King of Qin traveled to Ying and Chen.
s0131.idiomatic: The King of Qin traveled to Ying and Chen.

s0132.chinese: 荊將項燕立昌平君為荊王，反秦於淮南。
s0132.literal: General Xiang Yan of Jing installed Lord Changping as King of Jing and rebelled against Qin in Huainan.
s0132.idiomatic: General Xiang Yan of Jing installed Lord Changping as King of Jing and rebelled against Qin in Huainan.

s0133.chinese: 二十四年，王翦、蒙武攻荊，破荊軍，昌平君死，項燕遂自殺。
s0133.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Wang Jian and Meng Wu attacked Jing, defeated Jing's army; Lord Changping died, and Xiang Yan then committed suicide.
s0133.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Wang Jian and Meng Wu attacked Jing, defeated Jing's army; Lord Changping died, and Xiang Yan then committed suicide.

s0134.chinese: 二十五年，大興兵，使王賁將，攻燕遼東，得燕王喜。
s0134.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, they greatly mobilized troops and sent Wang Ben to command the attack on Yan's Liaodong, capturing King Xi of Yan.
s0134.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, they greatly mobilized troops and sent Wang Ben to command the attack on Yan's Liaodong, capturing King Xi of Yan.

s0135.literal: Returning, they attacked Dai and captured King Jia of Dai.
s0135.idiomatic: Returning, they attacked Dai and captured King Jia of Dai.

s0136.literal: Wang Jian then pacified the lands south of the Yangtze in Jing;
s0136.idiomatic: Wang Jian then pacified the lands south of the Yangtze in Jing;

s0137.literal: he accepted the surrender of the lord of Yue and established Kuaiji Commandery.
s0137.idiomatic: he accepted the surrender of the lord of Yue and established Kuaiji Commandery.

s0138.literal: In the fifth month, there was a great celebration throughout the land.
s0138.idiomatic: In the fifth month, there was a great celebration throughout the land.

s0139.chinese: 二十六年，齊王建與其相後勝發兵守其西界，不通秦。
s0139.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, King Jian of Qi with his prime minister Hou Sheng mobilized troops to defend the western border and cut off communication with Qin.
s0139.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, King Jian of Qi with his prime minister Hou Sheng mobilized troops to defend the western border and cut off communication with Qin.

s0140.chinese: 秦使將軍王賁從燕南攻齊，得齊王建。
s0140.literal: Qin sent General Wang Ben to attack Qi from south of Yan and captured King Jian of Qi.
s0140.idiomatic: Qin sent General Wang Ben to attack Qi from south of Yan and captured King Jian of Qi.
